p: Next, this result can be applied to the full evolutionary process, with compensatory mutation occurring at rate m. Let I 0( t) be the number of individuals infected with the reduced fitness strain, which has reproductive ratio R 1, and I 2( t) be the number of individuals infected with the compensated strain, with reproductive ratio R 2 > R 1. Although this method will work for more general fitness structures, in this paper we assume full fitness recovery, i.e. R 2 = R 0 S 2/ N, where S 2 is the number of individuals susceptible to strain 2.
